Table of Contents

Name

AuSetCloseDownMode - change the close down mode of a client

Synopsis

#include <audio/audiolib.h>

void AuSetCloseDownMode(server, mode, status) AuServer *server;
int mode;
AuStatus *status; /* RETURN */

Arguments

server
Specifies the connection to the audio server.
mode
Specifies the client close-down mode. This must be one of these constants: AuCloseDownDestroy, AuCloseDownRetainPermanent, or AuCloseDownRetainTemporary.
status
If non-NULL, flush the output buffer and return the status from the server.

Description

AuSetCloseDownMode sets the close-down-mode for client to mode. The close-down-mode determines what happens to the resources created by client when the connection is closed or client is killed via AuKillClient.

Errors

AuBadValue.

See Also

AuCloseServer, AuGetCloseDownMode.

audiolib - Network Audio System C Language Interface
